title: Understanding Miscarriage -- Symptoms
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

sections.heading: What Are the Symptoms of Miscarriage?
content: Typically, the symptoms of a miscarriage worsen as the miscarriage progresses. Spotting turns into heavier bleeding; cramping starts and becomes stronger.
Among pregnant women, any of the following symptoms may indicate miscarriage:
bullets: Vaginal bleeding or spotting, with or without cramps ; this bleeding may occur very early in your pregnancy -- even before you miss your menstrual period and know that you are pregnant -- or it may occur later, after you know you are pregnant. This is the most common symptom.
Mild-to-severe lower back pain , abdominal pain, or cramping, either constant or intermittent.
A blood -clot-like material, or a gush of clear or pink fluid that passes from the vagina .
Decrease in signs of pregnancy , such as loss of breast sensitivity or nausea .

Mild-to-severe lower back pain , abdominal pain, or cramping, either constant or intermittent.
A blood -clot-like material, or a gush of clear or pink fluid that passes from the vagina .
Decrease in signs of pregnancy , such as loss of breast sensitivity or nausea .

sections.heading: Call Your Doctor About a Miscarriage If:
bullets: You are pregnant and have vaginal bleeding, with or without cramps
You are pregnant and notice clot-like material passing from your vagina

items: You are pregnant and have vaginal bleeding, with or without cramps
You are pregnant and notice clot-like material passing from your vagina
